RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Sou ps-doutorando em filosofia na Universidade de So Paulo (USP/FAPESP) com um projeto sobre "A influncia da filosofia kantiana na origem dos textos inditos e publicados de Georges Canguilhem (com uma hiptese sobre a gnese da filosofia de Grard Lebrun)". Possuo ps-doutorado no IHPST de Paris (2019), no CIRST de Montral (2020), na Universit du Qubec Montral (2020), doutorado em Filosofia - Universit Montpellier 3, Frana (2015), mestrado em Filosofia e teoria da comunicao - Universit della Calabria, Itlia (2010) e graduao em Filosofia e teoria da comunicao - Universit della Calabria, Itlia (2005). Tenho experincia na rea da Filosofia, com nfase na filosofia da cincia, na filosofia da biologia, na filosofia da medicina, na epistemologia, na filosofia da linguagem e na esttica.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Filosofia e teoria da comunicao from Universit della Calabria (2005), master's at Filosofia e teoria da comunicao from Universit della Calabria (2010) and doctorate at Filosofia from Universit Montpellier 3 (2015). Has experience in Philosophy, focusing on Philosophy

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Letras e Cincias Humanas

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: A influncia da filosofia kantiana na origem dos textos inditos e publicados de Georges Canguilhem (com uma hiptese sobre a gnese da filosofia de Grard Lebrun)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Esse projeto, cuja ideia central nasce dos resultados das nossas pesquisas doutorais na Frana, pretende investigar as origens tericas do pensamento do filosofo francs Georges Canguilhem (1904-1995). Tradicionalmente, Canguilhem considerado como discpulo de Gaston Bachelard, j que ele foi seu sucessor na ctedra de filosofia e histria das cincias na Sorbonne. Recentes estudos, conduzidos em particular por Camille Limoges e Xavier Roth, tm porm indicado: 1) que teoricamente Canguilhem no foi um discpulo de Bachelard; 2) que Canguilhem, de um ponto de vista tanto terico quanto biogrfico, foi aluno do filsofo Alain (pseudnimo de mile-Auguste Chartier, 1868-1951), exponente da cole de l?activit, cujo ensino era baseado na transmisso dos princpios do kantismo. Em particular, segundo Roth, a obra de Canguilhem sofre nfluncia de Kant at 1939, ano do "dtour", o ponto de viragem terico autnomo.
Sem querer negar a originalidade do pensamento canguilhemiano, nosso projeto pretende demostrar a clara persistncia da influncia kantiana tambm depois de 1939, com base no apenas nos textos publicados, mas tambm de uma crescente quantidade de material indito (manuscritos, anotaes de cursos, cartas privada de Canguilhem, etc.), que ns tivemos a oportunidade de analisar durante nosso estgio de doutoramento no Centre d'Archives en Philosophie, Histoire et Edition des Sciences (CAPHS) de Paris ? centro de documentao sob a tutela do Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS) e da cole Normale Suprieure (Paris). 
Na obra do filosofo Grard Lebrun, discpulo de Canguilhem, e docente na Universidade de So Paulo por muitos anos, possvel encontrar algumas semelhanas tericas em comum entre Kant e Canguilhem ps-1939. Contando com a cooperao de reconhecidos estudiosos da obra do autor francs, entre as quais os prprios Limoges e Roth, com esse projeto gostaria de me integrar nas pesquisas do Departamento de Filosofia da Universidade de So Paulo, sobretudo no que diz respeito uma tradio que remonta ao ensino de Lebrun sobre a filosofia kantiana e o kantismo, no qual, como se espera mostrar, h traos oriundos das reflexes canguilhemianas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
This project, which stems from the findings of our PhD researches in France, aims to shed light on the theoretical origins of the thought of the French philosopher Georges Canguilhem (1904-1995). Traditionally, Canguilhem is considered to be a disciple of Gaston Bachelard, due to the fact that the latter was his predecessor at the chair of Philosophy and History of Science at the Sorbonne. However, recent studies, conducted in particular by Camille Limoges and Xavier Roth, have pointed out: 1) that Canguilhem was not, from a purely theoretical point of view, a disciple of Bachelard; 2) that Canguilhem, from a theoretical and also biographical point of view, was instead a disciple of the philosopher Alain, exponent of the ?Ecole de l?activit?, whose teaching consisted mainly in the transmission of the principles of Kantism. In particular, according to Roth, Canguilhem's work is heavily influenced by Kant until 1939, the year when the philosopher?s thought undergoes a ?dtour?, i.e. a turning point towards theoretical autonomy. 
Although we don't want to deny the theoretical originality of Canugilhemian thought, our project aims to demonstrate the marked persistence of the aforementioned Kantian influence even after 1939, on the basis of published texts and of a large amount of unpublished material in our possession, which was analysed at the CAPHS of Paris during our PhD (manuscripts, course notes, private letters, etc...). 
Indeed, the French philosopher Grard Lebrun, a disciple of Canguilhem and professor at USP for six years, showed some theoretical similarities that bind Kant and the post-1939 works of Canguilhem. By means of this project, which can take advantage of the collaboration of many international prominent academics, including the aforementioned Limoges and Roth, we would like to join the researchers of the USP philosophy department, who, thanks to their efforts on Kant and Kantism, are pursuing the ancient philosophical legacy of Lebrun and therefore, in our opinion, of Canguilhem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The Influence of Kant's Philosophy at the Origin of the Unpublished and Published Texts of Georges Canguilhem (with a hypothesis about the genesis of Grard Lebrun's philosophy)

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Institut d'histoire et de philosophie des sciences et des techniques

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: From the end of metaphysics to the conception of the organism: Kant, Lebrun and Canguilhem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Our main postdoctoral project aims to deepen, especially from a philosophical point of view, the Kant-Canguilhem-Lebrun theoretical lineage. In the light of the studies on philosophy and biology of our research group at the USP, with a first research period (6 months) at the IHPST in Paris under the direction of the Professor Philippe Huneman (last pupil of Lebrun), we would like to fortify the theoretical link between Kant, Canguilhem and Lebrun, proving that these three authors have in common not only a certain philosophy in the general sense, but also a well-defined conception of the philosophy of biology, according to which the living organism is characterized by an idea of internal finality. This conception breaks with the traditional idea of metaphysics, according to which the living being has its own reason for being in an external finality.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Centre interuniversitaire de recherche sur la science et la technologie

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Action, thought and organism: from Kant to Canguilhem via Alain.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Our main postdoctoral project aims to deepen the Kant-Canguilhem-Lebrun theoretical lineage. After a period of research at the IHPST of Paris with a Kant and Lebrun specialist (Huneman), with a second research period (6 months) at the CIRST of Montral (founded by Camille Limoges) we would like to study with Vincent Guillin, who is interested in the links between Canguilhem, Kant, the Ecole rflexive (Lachelier, Lagneau, Alain) and Descartes. In particular, demonstrating 1) that the master of Canguilhem (Alain) had transmitted to his pupil the Cartesian and Kantian principle of the antecedent of practical action with respect to abstract rules of thought and 2) that Canguilhem unlike Descartes and Alain applies this principle to the idea of organism, defining it as a biological principle, we would like to advance a thesis that the organism, in Canguilhem's philosophy, does not respond to an external finality (mechanical rules) but to an internal finality, i.e. precisely to a biological principle.
